title.narrative: WWF Adria-Serbia Climate Pact for Impact

description.narrative: The objective of the intervention is to increase the awareness on climate change among young citizens in Serbia. Empowering young people though learning, fact-finding, partnership building and small businesses development aim at contributing to climate adaptation and mitigation.

WWF Adria-Serbia har ansökt om finansiering från Sida med 5 miljoner SEK för att genomföra projektet "Climate Pact for Impact" i Serbien under perioden 2019-2022.
Insatsens har som övergripande mål att förbättra kunskapen och utbildningen om klimatfrågor och Agenda 2030 i Serbien med ett särskilt fokus på unga. Delmålen för detta omfattar att 1) Förbättra klimatutbildning i minst 20 grundskolor och tre universitet, vilket kommer göras genom att arbeta med konkreta utbildningsinsatser med ett tydligt fokus på aktivt lärande för att kunna bidra till minskad klimatpåverkan, 2) Att stärka kunskapen om klimatförändringarnas påverkan och möjligheten att skapa ett uthålligt samhälle, vilket inkluderar utbildning av journalister och kunskapshöjande åtgärder på lokal nivå, och 3) Att stärka partnerskap och dialog om klimatförändringar genom samarbete med unga företagare, vilket kommer göras genom att stärka uppstartsföretag i deras utveckling av klimatsmarta företagslösningar.
WWF Adria-Serbien kommer att genomföra aktiviteten i samarbete med skolor, universitet, företag, journalister och företags- och ungdomsorganisationer. Insatsens totala budget är 5 miljoner SEK.

WWF Adria-Serbia has applied to Sida for funding of 5 million SEK to carry out the "Climate Pact for Impact" project in Serbia during the period 2019-2022.
The intervention aims at enhancing awareness and education of on climate change and the SDGs in Serbia with focus on young population. The objectives include to 1) Enhance Climate Change Education in at least 20 primary and secondary schools and 3 universities, which will be done through concrete education activities with the focus on active learning and reduced climate impact, 2) Raise awareness about climate change impacts and the imperative of building a resilient society through media, networking and partnerships, which include training of journalists and awareness raising on local level, and 3) Strengthen partnership for change by enhancing quality of dialogue on climate change through collaboration and partnerships with the business community with focus on young population, which will be done through supporting climate start-ups and development of climate smart businesses.
WWF Adria-Serbia will implement the intervention together with schools, universities, businesses, journalists and business- and youth organisations. The interventions total budget is 5 million SEK.

description.narrative: The project Climate Pact for Impact could adapt well to the Covid-19 situation since many of the activities were designed for e-learning or could go online. During the year important results achieved including e-learning courses in the curricula of several universities reaching about 250 students, and interactive courses including training of trainers reaching about 1500 school children. The results wil be sustained through continues use of the e-learning platforms. Also the project has reached results in training of investigative journalists and production of articles, as well as training support to start-up companies to develop climate smart business ideas. During the project period, climate change has gradually got more societal attention, why an unexpected result has been a strong interest among teachers in schools to have training in climate change issues as well as increased attention on social media.
